info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 29 at 12:35PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Silver Bow County through 100 PM MDT... At 1234 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Butte to Divide. Movement was southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Butte, Divide, Janney, Newcomb, Melrose and Dewey. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 222 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
